channel.title: 'java' is not reconized as an internal or external command command operable prog
channel.description:
:( help me please because i was messing around with my system variables which i probably have shouldnt and i changed the CLASSPATH and the Path and now when ever i try to run my server it says 'java' is not recognized as an internal or external command operable program or batch file. And i dont know how to fix it and change my CLASSPATH and Path back to normal. If ur wondering what java i have its Java(TM) 6 update 14.
PLEASE HELP ME, NOT ONLY CANT I RUN MY SERVER BUT I CANT GO ON OTHER PEOPLES SERVER AS WELL

item.title: 'java' is not reconized as an internal or external command command operable prog

Follow the ‘how to make a server’ guide in the tutorial section.

item.title: 'java' is not reconized as an internal or external command command operable prog
item.dc:creator: @xxckwxx xxckwxx
item.description:
@xxckwxx wrote:

@echo off
if exist “%programfiles%\Java” (call :compile “%programfiles%\Java”) else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load.
“%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe” http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp
:end
echo Finished!
pause
exit

This should work as a compiler, its a great one works with all computers. If you have javac on your computer it will find it.

Read full topic
item.source: 'java' is not reconized as an internal or external command command operable prog

item.title: 'java' is not reconized as an internal or external command command operable prog
item.dc:creator: @PushedPrawn PushedPrawn
item.description:
@PushedPrawn wrote:

[quote=“moparscape5399, post:1, topic:303199”] help me please because i was messing around with my system variables which i probably have shouldnt and i changed the CLASSPATH and the Path and now when ever i try to run my server it says ‘java’ is not recognized as an internal or external command operable program or batch file. And i dont know how to fix it and change my CLASSPATH and Path back to normal. If ur wondering what java i have its Java™ 6 update 14.

PLEASE HELP ME, NOT ONLY CANT I RUN MY SERVER BUT I CANT GO ON OTHER PEOPLES SERVER AS WELL[/quote]

Well, you should be able to go onto another persons server… As long as you can load a Silabsoft client or Mopar’s then you’re fine.

But… If you have JDK 6_14… your CLASSPATH should look like this:

.;CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_14\bin;%CLASSPATH%;C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\lib\ext\QTJava.zip

That’s just what mine looks like just edited for update 14… That should work, but I’m not 100% sure.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 19, 2009, 11:37:44 am[/size][hr]Also, if your PATH is fucked up instead of CLASSPATH… Your PATH should look something like this:

%SystemRoot%\system32;%SystemRoot%;%SystemRoot%\System32\Wbem;C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin;C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\bin;C:\Program Files\Java\j2re1.4.2_03\bin;C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\jre\bin;C:\Program Files\QuickTime\QTSystem\

You probably don’t have nearly as much junk in there, but ehh… i took that from my dads computer and sent it to mine and it works for me:)

Read full topic
